text:
Hi guys, I have a problem of `Array`. Can anyone help me? Thanks!
`test = fill([], 4)`
`push!(test[1], 1)`
I expect that `test` is `[1], [0], [0], [0]` . However it actually is `[1], [1], [1], [1]` . I'm wondering how to fix this.

elements.text: Hi guys, I have a problem of
Array
. Can anyone help me? Thanks!
test = fill([], 4)
push!(test[1], 1)
I expect that
test
is
. However it actually is
. I'm wondering how to fix this.

text: you're creating an array filled with 4 references to the same inner array

elements.text: you're creating an array filled with 4 references to the same inner array

text:
```julia> a                      
4-element Vector{Vector{Any}}:
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
                              
julia> a[1] === a[2]          
true                          ```

elements.text:
julia> a                      
4-element Vector{Vector{Any}}:
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
                              
julia> a[1] === a[2]          
true

text:
one way is to use a comprehension here:

```julia> b = [ [] for _ in 1:4 ]
4-element Vector{Vector{Any}}:
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
                              
julia> b[1] === b[2]          
false                      
   
julia> push!(b[1], 1)         
1-element Vector{Any}:        
 1                            
                              
julia> b                      
4-element Vector{Vector{Any}}:
 [1]                          
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           ```

elements.text: one way is to use a comprehension here:

julia> b = [ [] for _ in 1:4 ]
4-element Vector{Vector{Any}}:
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
 []                           
                              
julia> b[1] === b[2]          
false                      
   
julia> push!(b[1], 1)         
1-element Vector{Any}:        
 1                            
                              
julia> b                      
4-element Vector{Vector{Any}}:
 [1]                          
 []                           
 []                           
 []

text: keep in mind that you'll have `Array{Any}` here, which may lead to suboptimal performance compared to a concrete element type

elements.text: keep in mind that you'll have
Array{Any}
here, which may lead to suboptimal performance compared to a concrete element type

text: Yeah! It works! Thank you a lot!:+1:

elements.text: Yeah! It works! Thank you a lot!
Thanks for your tips

text: In the future, please don't immediately double post in two channels and favor <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk> for these kinds of questions - most of the people willing to help out lurk in both channels anyway, but <#C6A044SQH|helpdesk> is mde specifically for them.
